title: Trump calls impeachment inquiry a ‘lynching’
text:
US President Donald Trump deployed inflammatory rhetoric to describe the Democratic-led probe into his conduct while in office | Alex Wong/Getty Images Trump calls impeachment inquiry a ‘lynching’ The comment marks a new, racially insensitive measure of malice by the US president toward lawmakers’ impeachment efforts.

U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday referred to the impeachment inquiry in the House of Representatives as “a lynching,” deploying perhaps his most inflammatory rhetoric yet to describe the Democratic-led probe into his conduct while in office.

“So some day, if a Democrat becomes President and the Republicans win the House, even by a tiny margin, they can impeach the President, without due process or fairness or any legal rights,” he wrote on Twitter. “All Republicans must remember what they are witnessing here - a lynching. But we will WIN!”

Trump has frequently used the phrase “witch hunt” and deployed other politically explosive language to denigrate the work of former special counsel Robert Mueller and various congressional investigations into his administration.

But the invocation of the term “lynching” to characterize a legislative process explicitly sanctioned by the Constitution marks a new, racially insensitive measure of malice by the president toward lawmakers’ impeachment efforts.

In other tweets Tuesday morning, touted his approval rating among Republican voters, referenced various “Fox & Friends” segments, and applauded GOP support for a failed resolution to censure Rep. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.) — one of the leaders of the impeachment inquiry.
description: The comment marks a new, racially insensitive measure of malice by the US president toward lawmakers’ impeachment efforts.
